content.description: Sit start on good Huecos just right of a fallen block at the right side of Double Vision boulder.  Move slightly left and make a big move to a good crimp.  From here make a big move to a nice Hueco Jug and top out up and right.
content.protection: This one is pretty high above a bad landing so best not to fall.  Lot's of pads and spotters to protect it well.
content.location: Right side of Double Vision boulder.

content.description: Climbs the arete to the left of Double Vision. Start on the jug climb on small pockets and edges up the wave-like arete to a Hueco with a crack around its bottom (hence the name).
content.protection: two - three pads and a spot.
content.location: Arete to the left of Double Vision on the Double Vision Boulder.

content.description:
Classic tall problem with a high crux. Exciting! 

  Start on the undercling with your feet on the block. Snake eye pockets in the middle of the face mark the beginning of the business. From here it's not many moves, but you start relatively high and the crux is gaining the lip. Fortunately the landing is flat and open, just watch the yucca at the left side.
content.protection: Pad it far to protect the final throw.
content.location: Up the belly of the main Double Vision boulder - look for the pair of 2 finger pockets.

content.description: Sit start back in the cave and climb a cool feature on good holds up and out of the cave.  From here pull on some tiny crimps and dishes, work the feet and pull onto the slab.
content.protection: Pad's and Spotters, watch the wall behind as you climb onto the slab
content.location: Back side of Double Vision Boulder.  Climb down into a small pit.

content.description: At the far Southwest corner of the North Mountain Meadow lies this tall boulder.  This area offers a selection of moderates from V0 to the namesake of the area Double Vision V7.  The main face is shaded, and the other problems are protected by the sun from other boulders.
